translation: The oracle that Habakkuk the prophet beheld.
How long, O LORD, have I cried for help, and You do not hear? I cry out to You, “Violence!” yet You do not save.
Why do You make me see iniquity, and cause me to behold trouble? Devastation and violence are before me; and strife arises, and contention lifts itself up.
Therefore the law grows numb, and justice never goes forth, for the wicked surrounds the righteous; therefore justice goes forth perverted.
Look among the nations, and behold, and be utterly astounded; for I am working a work in your days which you will not believe, though it be told.
For behold, I am raising up the Chaldeans, that bitter and hasty nation, which marches through the breadths of the earth to possess dwelling places that are not its own.
He is dreadful and terrible; from himself his judgment and his majesty proceed.
Swifter than leopards are his horses, and fiercer than the wolves of evening; his horsemen press on, and his horsemen come from afar; they fly like an eagle that hastens to devour.
All of them come for violence; the set of their faces is forward, and they gather captives like the sand.
He, indeed, scoffs at kings, and rulers are a laughingstock to him; he laughs at every stronghold, and heaps up earth and takes it.
Then a wind sweeps by and passes on, and he is guilty; this, his strength, is his god.
Are You not from everlasting, O LORD my God, my Holy One? We shall not die. O LORD, You have appointed him for judgment; and You, O Rock, have established him for reproof.
You are of purer eyes than to behold evil, and cannot look upon wrong; why do You look upon those who deal treacherously, and are silent when the wicked swallows up one more righteous than he?
And You make mankind like the fish of the sea, like creeping things that have no ruler over them.
All of them he brings up with a hook; he drags them in his net, and gathers them in his dragnet; therefore he rejoices and is glad.
Therefore he sacrifices to his net and burns incense to his dragnet, for by them his portion is rich and his food choice.
Shall he therefore empty his net, and continually slay nations without sparing?
I will stand upon my watch, and set myself upon the rampart, and I will watch to see what he will speak in me, and what I shall answer concerning my reproof.
And the LORD answered me and said, Write the vision and make it plain upon tablets, that he may run who reads it.
For the vision is yet for the appointed time, and it hastens toward the end and will not lie. Though it delay, wait for it, for it will surely come, it will not tarry.
Behold, his soul is puffed up; it is not upright within him, but the righteous shall live by his faithfulness.

Moreover, indeed, wine is treacherous: a proud man, he shall not abide, who enlarges his desire like Sheol, and is as death and cannot be satisfied, but gathers to himself all the nations and heaps to himself all the peoples.
Shall not all these take up a proverb against him, and a taunting riddle for him, and say, Woe to him who heaps up what is not his—how long?—and who loads himself with thick clay.
Shall not your creditors suddenly arise, and those who make you tremble awake, and you shall become plunder for them?
Because you have plundered many nations, all the remnant of the peoples shall plunder you, for the blood of man and the violence done to the land, to the city and to all who dwell in it.
Woe to him who gains evil profit for his house, to set his nest on high, to be delivered from the hand of evil.
You have plotted shame for your house, cutting off many peoples, and you have sinned against your own soul.
For the stone shall cry out from the wall, and the beam out of the timber shall answer it.
Woe to him who builds a city with blood, and establishes a town by iniquity.
Is it not, behold, from the LORD of hosts that peoples toil for the fire, and nations weary themselves for emptiness?
For the earth shall be filled with the knowledge of the glory of the LORD, as the waters cover the sea.
Woe to him who gives his neighbor drink, who adds your wrath and also makes him drunk, in order to gaze upon their nakedness.
You are filled with shame instead of glory; drink, you also, and be exposed. The cup of the LORD’s right hand shall turn upon you, and disgrace shall be upon your glory.
For the violence done to Lebanon shall cover you, and the destruction of beasts that terrified them, because of the blood of man and the violence of the land, of the city and of all who dwell in it.
What profit is the carved image, that its maker has carved it, the molten image and a teacher of lies, that the maker of his work trusts in it, to fashion mute idols?
Woe to him who says to the wood, Awake; to the silent stone, Arise, it shall teach. Behold, it is overlaid with gold and silver, yet there is no breath at all within it.
But the LORD is in His holy temple; let all the earth be silent before Him.
A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet, according to Shigionoth.
O LORD, I have heard the report of You; I stand in awe of Your work. In the midst of the years revive it; in the midst of the years make it known. In wrath remember mercy.
God comes from Teman, and the Holy One from Mount Paran. Selah. His splendor covers the heavens, and the earth is full of His praise.
And brightness shall be as the light; rays from his hand go forth to him, and there his power is hidden.
Before him goes pestilence, and burning plague comes forth at his feet.
He stood and measured the earth; he looked and made the nations tremble. The ancient mountains were shattered, the everlasting hills sank low. His ways are everlasting.
Under affliction I saw the tents of Cushan; the curtains of the land of Midian trembled.
Was the LORD enraged against the rivers? Was your anger against the rivers, or your wrath against the sea, that you rode upon your horses, your chariots of salvation?
You bare your bow, laid open for battle; the oaths of the tribes are a sure word. Selah. You cleave the earth with rivers.
The mountains saw you and writhed; a torrent of waters swept by. The deep gave forth its voice; it lifted high its hands.
Sun and moon stood still in their lofty abode; at the light of Your arrows they went, at the brightness of the flashing of Your spear.
In indignation you march through the earth; in anger you thresh the nations.
You went forth for the salvation of Your people, for the salvation of Your anointed; You crushed the head from the house of the wicked, laying bare the foundation even to the neck. Selah.
You pierced with his own spears the head of his warriors; they stormed out to scatter me, their exultation as though to devour the poor in secret.
You trod the sea with Your horses, the surging of many waters.

I heard, and my inward parts trembled; at the sound my lips quivered. Rottenness entered into my bones, and under me I shook, that I should rest for the day of trouble, for the coming up of the people that invades us.

Though the fig tree does not blossom, nor is there fruit on the vines; the labor of the olive fails, and the fields yield no food; the flock is cut off from the fold, and there is no herd in the stalls.
Yet I will rejoice in the LORD, I will exult in the God of my salvation.
The Lord, the LORD, is my strength; he makes my feet like the deer, and upon my high places he causes me to tread. For the choirmaster, with my stringed instruments.
